thanks for the suggestion ,
  yes,i'm using Heritrix 1.12.1
  i just run the eclipse and operate heritrix run as java application
  when i reset the computer ,i found the NicknameQueueAssignmentPolicy 
  in the Heritrix Web UI,
   
  but problem occured again, when using NicknameQueueAssignmentPolicy 
  in a period of time it download very fast ,50 of  50 active thread ,but when time
  goes,there is just one active thread , 
   
  i don't know the reason why it happens ,could you help me with this problem
  thank you very much for help!

Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
          Keeping track of the several levels of escaping can be challenging.

My main suggestion would be that even if you are composing the order.xml 
directly for your actual crawl, try entering/testing your desired 
expressions via the web admin UI. Then you can see how the software 
writes a working expression to XML.

I don't believe there are any bugs that would prevent the use of regexes 
matching '&' characters, but the testing-through-UI process would be 
the best way to completely rule that out.

There was one issue with handling dangling '&' characters in a 
supporting library that was fixed in 1.12.1 by upgrading that library 
(see http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-1127 ) -- but I don't 
think that's what you're seeing. Are you using 1.12.1?

- Gordon @ IA

Andrea Goethals wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> The last part of my DecidingScope profiles includes a section to
> exclude any URIs that match any regular expressions in a list of 0 or
> more URIs like this example:
> 
> <newObject name="rejectExcluded"
> class="org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesListRegExpDecideRule">
> <string name="decision">REJECT</string>
> <string name="list-logic">OR</string>
> <stringList name="regexp-list">
> <string>http://www\.example\.com</string>
> </stringList>
> </newObject>
> 
> 
> 
> The URIs to exclude are pulled from a database and added to this
> section of the order.xml programatically just before a crawl. I'm
> running into problems getting the correct escaping for the regular
> expression even after looking at examples in the manual and mailing
> list. I'm trying to come up with all the characters that need escaping
> before they can go into this section of the order.xml. It seems like
> there's 2 types of escaping needed, one to go from the URI to the Java
> regular expression, and the other to make it XML-compatible.
> 
> The special characters for XML are < > & ' "
> I think that only the & can occur in a URI so I tried converting the &
> in the URIs to & for the XML but then the pattern doesn't match a
> URI with just & instead of &
> I experimented with using
> <string><![CDATA[uri-with-nonescaped-special-xml-chars]]></string>
> to get around doing any conversion for the XML. I'm not sure it that
> worked or not, I need to test it again.
> 
> The characters in the URI that need to be escaped for the Java regular
> expression are at least . and ?
> I'm not sure if the / character needs to be escaped.
> 
> Is anyone doing something similar or have a better grasp on all the
> characters that need to be converted when going from URI -> Java
> Regular expression -> XML?
> 
> thanks,
> Andrea
> 
> 
> 
> Yahoo! Groups Links
> 
> 
>
